segment.source: Authoring Recording Profiles
segment.target: Authoring Recording Profiles

segment.source: Authoring Recording Profiles
segment.target: Authoring Recording Profiles

segment.source: Authoring Recording Profiles
segment.target: Authoring Recording Profiles

segment.source: You can author Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording profiles in an XML file that has a .wprp extension.
segment.target: You can author Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording profiles in an XML file that has a .wprp extension.

segment.source: Recording profiles contain all the necessary information to enable performance recording for a specific scenario.
segment.target: Recording profiles contain all the necessary information to enable performance recording for a specific scenario.

segment.source: This data includes information about Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) sessions, providers, and keywords.
segment.target: This data includes information about Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) sessions, providers, and keywords.

segment.source: Each .wprp file contains at least one profile definition, which consolidates a specific set of ETW sessions and providers.
segment.target: Each .wprp file contains at least one profile definition, which consolidates a specific set of ETW sessions and providers.

segment.source: A profile definition also includes the session and provider attributes that start and control performance recording.
segment.target: A profile definition also includes the session and provider attributes that start and control performance recording.

segment.source: WPR profiles support the following ETW features:
segment.target: WPR profiles support the following ETW features:

segment.source: Sequential file and circular memory logging modes.
segment.target: Sequential file and circular memory logging modes.

segment.source: User-specified number of buffers and buffer sizes for each session.
segment.target: User-specified number of buffers and buffer sizes for each session.

segment.source: ETW system logger sessions together with the NT Kernel Logger.
segment.target: ETW system logger sessions together with the NT Kernel Logger.

segment.source: This merger includes the ability to specify keywords, stacks, and memory pool tags.
segment.target: This merger includes the ability to specify keywords, stacks, and memory pool tags.

segment.source: Event sessions that specify a provider name or GUID, keywords, stack, detail level, and non-paged memory.
segment.target: Event sessions that specify a provider name or GUID, keywords, stack, detail level, and non-paged memory.

segment.source: Capturing state providers that capture state during start or save operations only.
segment.target: Capturing state providers that capture state during start or save operations only.

segment.source: The .wprp file must contain specific definitions that are listed in a specific order.
segment.target: The .wprp file must contain specific definitions that are listed in a specific order.

segment.source: The following topics describe how to author the definitions in that order.
segment.target: The following topics describe how to author the definitions in that order.

segment.source: Authoring .wprp files in Visual Studio
segment.target: Authoring .wprp files in Visual Studio

segment.source: You can use Visual Studio to author a recording profile by using the WPR schema file, WPRControlProfiles.xsd, that is available in the WPT install folder:
segment.target: You can use Visual Studio to author a recording profile by using the WPR schema file, WPRControlProfiles.xsd, that is available in the WPT install folder:

segment.source: Open your .wprp file in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Open your .wprp file in Visual Studio.

segment.source: In the main menu, choose XML, and then choose Schemas…
segment.target: In the main menu, choose XML, and then choose Schemas…

segment.source: In the XML Schemas dialog that appears, choose Add…
segment.target: In the XML Schemas dialog that appears, choose Add…

segment.source: Choose the WPRControlProfiles.xsd schema.
segment.target: Choose the WPRControlProfiles.xsd schema.

segment.source: By default, this file is in the WPT install directory:
segment.target: By default, this file is in the WPT install directory:

segment.source: Once you have selected the schema, you can use context-sensitive IntelliSense to author your .wprp file.
segment.target: Once you have selected the schema, you can use context-sensitive IntelliSense to author your .wprp file.
